prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Bikini
Description: A hearty, motherly nun at Hazakura Temple, a channeling dojo deep in the mountains.
Character 5
Name: Elise Deauxnim
Description: Kind-eyed author and illustrator of picture books. Pearls is huge fan of hers.
Character 6
Name: Iris
Description: A nun at Hazakura Temple. She reminds me so much of "her"...
Character 7
Name: Laurice Deauxnim* (when playing as Wright) → Larry Butz* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Description: Better known as Larry Butz. Current in training as Elise Deauxnim's pupil.
Character 8
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My friend since grade school. Fell from Dusky Bridge and is currently hospitalized.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 10
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor, Manfred von Karma's, daughter. Born/raised in Germany. Prosecutor at 13.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: An old friend. Said to be #1 at the D.A.'s office. Studies foreign judicial systems now.
Character 12
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Older sister of Misty Fey and mother of Pearl and Iris. Is in solitary confinement.
Character 13
Name: ?????? → Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Morgan Fey's daughter and Iris's twin sister. Her father deals in jewelry apparently.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. He wasn't serious when he gave this to me... was he?* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 1
Name: Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. Something about reading people's hearts... What utter nonsense.* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 2
Name: Oh! Cult! New Year's Issue
Description: An occult magazine featuring Hazakura Temple. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Hazakura Temple Map
Description: Shows Hazakura Temple and the surrounding area. Click here for details.
Evidence 4
Name: Hanging Scroll
Description: Shows Misty Fey, Master of the Kurain Technique. Click here for details. Misty Fey's image is obscured by gravy. Click here for details.
Evidence 5
Name: Photo of Elise
Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. She is wearing a white robe and a hood. She was holding a book and a staff. The staff has a crystal sphere attached to it.
Evidence 6
Name: Iris's Hood
Description: A hood that Iris wears at all times. A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.
Iris:
If it's alright with you... I would like you to have this.

Phoenix:
But this is your hood...
Evidence 7
Name: Weather Data
Description: A regional weather report for the night of the crime.
Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

Snow: 7 to approx. 10:50 PM
Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

Lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45.
Around 30 minutes passed between
the fire starting and going out.
Evidence 8
Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. There is no crystal sphere attached. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. A seven-branched, jagged sword. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12
Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.
Evidence 13
Name: Crime Photo
Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. [caption] One track is shown leading from Main Gate to Dusky Bridge.
Evidence 15
Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. Click here for details.
Evidence 16
Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17
Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.
Evidence 20
Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.
Evidence 21
Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That night I was helping an acolyte with her training in the Inner Temple. But...
Person: Bikini
Testimony 1
Testimony: Well, as you can see, my back likes to act up. Violently.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 2
Testimony: So, I left Iris to help the acolyte, and returned to Hazakura Temple.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 3
Testimony: Iris came to the Inner Temple. She was dressed exactly as she had been at dinner.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 4
Testimony: There's no bath at the Inner Temple, you see, and I needed a long, hot soak.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was after I had finished, just as I was heading back... that's when I saw it!
Person: Bikini

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, so I need to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's see what we've got here.

First, the characters involved are a bunch of people from different backgrounds—lawyers, nuns, detectives, and some spiritual folks. The main event seems to be the murder of Elise Deauxnim, who was a well-known author and illustrator. The crime happened five years ago, and now, Phoenix Wright is trying to defend someone, possibly Terry Fawles, who was sentenced to death but escaped custody two days ago.

Looking at the evidences, there's a lot to unpack. The Attorney's Badge is new, which might be important for Phoenix's case. The Magatama from Maya Fey reacts to people with secrets, which could indicate someone's guilt. There's an occult magazine about Hazakura Temple, which is where the murder happened. The Hanging Scroll has Misty Fey's image, but it's covered in gravy, which seems odd. A photo of Elise is taken by her pupil, Laurice, who's now Larry Butz. Iris gave Phoenix her hood, which is magical and offers protection from spirits.

The Weather Data shows that it was snowing with lightning strikes around the time of the crime. Lightning hit Dusky Bridge at 10:45 PM, and the fire started around then, taking about 30 minutes to go out. There's a note to Iris found in the Main Hall, and a Victim's Staff that has her fingerprints but no crystal sphere. The Shichishito was the apparent murder weapon but wasn't actually used. Elise's Autopsy Report shows she died between 10 and 11 PM from a stab wound, fell 10 feet after death. Iris was in her room until the murder was discovered. The Crime Photo shows the courtyard where she was killed, and a Tracks Photo shows a path from the Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. Larry's Sketch of the crime scene is horrible, but the Crystal Sphere found near Dusky Bridge has blood on it, likely from Elise's staff. The Kurain Master's Talisman was on Elise and was found in the garden. A Burnt Letter from Morgan Fey was found in the incinerator, and a Dagger was found stuck in a pine tree, but the blood doesn't match Elise's.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Bikini, the nun, was helping an acolyte but left Iris alone. She had a bad back and needed a soak, so she went to her room after lighting the lamps. She came back later and saw something strange—maybe the murder weapon or a body part. 

So, which evidence and testimony contradict each other? Let's think. The Weather Data says lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45 PM, leading to a fire. But the autopsy shows Elise died at 10-11 PM, and the fire went out around 11 PM. That seems contradictory because the lightning would have caused the fire, but she died around the same time.

Wait, but the note from the Weather Data says the lightning struck at 10:45 PM, and the fire started around then, taking about 30 minutes to go out. If Elise died at 10-11 PM, that could mean she was killed during the lightning strike or shortly after. The fire would have been from the lightning, but if she died before the fire went out, that could explain it. Maybe the lightning caused the fire, but she was already dead by then. So the timeline matches, but it's a bit confusing.

Alternatively, maybe the lightning struck the bridge, causing a fire, but Elise was already dead by the time the fire started. So the evidence about the lightning causing the fire and her dying at 10-11 PM doesn't contradict each other; they just happened around the same time.

Hmm, perhaps another pair. The Dagger was found in the garden with blood that doesn't match Elise's. But the Shichishito was the apparent murder weapon but wasn't used. Maybe the Dagger is the actual murder weapon, and the Shichishito is a distraction. If the testimony says the Dagger was found but the blood doesn't match, that could be a contradiction if the Dagger was the weapon.

Or, looking at the Crystal Sphere, which was found near Dusky Bridge with blood. Since Elise's staff had a crystal sphere, maybe the sphere was used to commit the murder. If the testimony says it's from the staff, but the evidence says it was found separately, that could be a contradiction.

Wait, but the Crystal Sphere was part of the staff, which was found with blood. The sphere itself was found near the bridge with blood, so maybe the blood came from the staff, not the sphere. That could mean the sphere wasn't used as a weapon but was part of the staff.

Another angle: The Weather Data mentions lightning strikes, but the Crime Photo shows no lightning damage, which might be odd. But the lightning caused the fire, not necessarily damage to the area where Elise was killed.

I think the main contradiction is between the Dagger and the Shichishito. The testimony about the Dagger's blood not matching Elise's versus the Shichishito being the apparent weapon but not the actual one. Or maybe the Crystal Sphere and the staff's connection.

Wait, the Evidence 10 says the Shichishito had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints but wasn't the murder weapon. The Dagger had blood that didn't match. So, the Shichishito was a decoy, and the Dagger was the actual weapon. But the testimony might say the Dagger was found, but it wasn't used, which contradicts if it was the actual weapon.

Alternatively, the Crystal Sphere was part of the staff, which was used as the murder weapon. If the testimony says the staff was the weapon, but the evidence says the sphere was found separately, that's a contradiction.

I think the best pair is the Weather Data and the Crime Photo, but I'm not sure. Alternatively, the Dagger and Shichishito.

Wait, the user's previous answer was {"evidence": 5, "testimony": 0}, so maybe that's the intended pair. Evidence 5 is the Scarf, and Testimony 0 is Fawles saying he wasn't there. But in this case, the Scarf evidence is about Elise, not Valerie. Maybe it's a different pair.

Alternatively, in this current case, the Evidence 5 is the Crystal Sphere, and Testimony 0 is Bikini's testimony about seeing something after the murder. Maybe they contradict about the presence of the Crystal Sphere at the crime scene.

But I'm getting confused. I think the main contradiction is between the Dagger and the Shichishito. The Dagger had blood that didn't match, but the Shichishito was the apparent weapon. If the testimony says the Dagger was the actual weapon, but the evidence says it wasn't, that's a contradiction.
</think>

cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this scenario. First, I need to understand the setup.

There are multiple characters involved, including Phoenix Wright, Maya Fey, Dick Gumshoe, and others. The crime in question involves the murder of Elise Deauxnim, a kind-eyed author and illustrator, who was killed on Dusky Bridge. The prime suspect is Terry Fawles, who was seen arguing with Elise before the murder.

Looking at the testimonies, I see that Bikini, a nun at Hazakura Temple, testified that she saw Iris (a fellow nun) without her hood on the night of the crime. This is a key point because Iris's hood is magical and is supposed to protect her from evil spirits. If she wasn't wearing it, it could mean she was exposed or that something was amiss.

Now, looking at the evidence, there's a "Hanging Scroll" that shows Misty Fey, the master of the Kurain Tradition. However, the scroll's image of Misty is obscured by gravy, which seems odd. This could indicate that the evidence is unreliable or that there's something hidden or altered within it.

Comparing these, the testimony about Iris not wearing her hood suggests that there might have been a breach in her protection that night. On the other hand, the Hanging Scroll's condition makes me question the reliability of the evidence itself. If the scroll is crucial to the case and it's damaged or obscured, it could mean that the evidence is not trustworthy, which would directly contradict the testimony that relies on the Hood's presence or absence.

So, the contradiction seems to be between the Hanging Scroll's condition (Evidence 4) and the testimony about Iris not wearing her hood (Testimony 3). The Hanging Scroll's reliability is called into question, which in turn affects the credibility of the testimony.
</think>

cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. I'm a bit new to this, but I'll try to go through everything step by step.

First, I'll look at the characters involved. There's Phoenix Wright, who's a defense attorney, and he's working with Maya Fey, his assistant. There's also Mia Fey, who's Phoenix's late sister and a mentor. Then there's Pearl Fey, who's a cousin and a channeling prodigy. Bikini is a nun at Hazakura Temple, and Elise Deauxnim is a kind-eyed author and illustrator, who's also a fan of Phoenix. Iris is a nun at the temple, and Larry Butz is training under Elise. There's also Dick Gumshoe, the detective, and some other characters like Franziska von Karma and Miles Edgeworth.

Now, looking at the evidences, there's a lot here. The Attorney's Badge is Phoenix's badge, which is brand new. Then there's Maya's Magatama, which reacts to people's secrets. There's an occult magazine featuring Hazakura Temple, a map of the temple, a hanging scroll of Misty Fey, a photo of Elise, Iris's hood, weather data showing snow and lightning strikes around the time of the crime, a note to Iris, Elise's staff with a hidden sword, the apparent murder weapon Shichishito, Elise's autopsy report, Iris's testimony, a crime photo, tracks leading to Dusky Bridge, Larry's sketch, a crystal sphere found near Dusky Bridge with blood, Elise's talisman, a burnt letter from Morgan Fey, a dagger in the garden, a stone lantern, and a photo of Dusky Bridge.

The testimonies include statements from Bikini, who was helping an acolyte, heard a noise, saw Iris without her hood, and noticed Mystic Ami stabbing Elise. She also fainted and upon waking saw Ami attacking Elise.

So, looking for contradictions, I need to find where evidence and testimony don't align. For example, the weather data says there was lightning at 10:45 PM, but the crime happened at 10:50 PM. That's a 5-minute gap. The testimony mentions the sword was already in place when she looked, but the lightning struck at 10:45, which could mean the fire started then, but the crime happened a few minutes later. Maybe the sword was used around that time.

Also, the crystal sphere was found near Dusky Bridge with blood, suggesting it was the murder weapon. But the Shichishito was the apparent murder weapon with blood and fingerprints. This could be a contradiction if the sphere is the actual weapon or just evidence at the scene.

In the testimonies, Bikini saw the sword in place and heard the stabbing. But if the lightning struck at 10:45 and the crime was at 10:50, there's a timeline issue. Also, she didn't see the stabbing, but heard it, which could mean she's not a reliable witness.

So, putting this together, the evidence about the lightning and the timeline might contradict the testimony from Bikini about the timing of the stabbing. Additionally, the crystal sphere and Shichishito both having blood could be conflicting pieces of evidence if only one is the actual murder weapon.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. So, from what I understand, the crime happened on Dusky Bridge, and there's a lot of evidence and testimonies pointing towards different suspects. The key pieces of evidence are the weather report, the tracks, and the burned letter. The testimonies include statements from Bikini, who was a witness to the crime.

First, looking at the weather data, it mentions that there was snow and lightning strikes around 10:45 PM. Lightning struck Dusky Bridge, and the fire started around that time, with the fire lasting until 11 PM. This means that the crime likely happened around the time of the lightning strike or shortly after.

Next, the tracks photo shows that a snowmobile was used to get to Dusky Bridge. This suggests that the suspect used a snowmobile to reach the bridge. However, the time it takes to walk to Dusky Bridge is about 15 minutes, but with a snowmobile, it would take less than 5 minutes.

Bikini's testimony says that after she reported the crime, she went to the Main Gate and saw tracks indicating a snowmobile had been used. She also mentions that she saw tracks leading from the Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. This aligns with the evidence showing that a snowmobile was used.

However, there's also a testimony from Bikini where she suggests that Iris could have done the crime because she can drive a snowmobile. But wait, Iris is a nun who is supposed to be in her room during the time of the crime. So, if Iris was in her room, she couldn't have been driving a snowmobile to commit the murder.

But looking back at the evidence, the Crystal Sphere was found near Dusky Bridge, and it had blood on it. This suggests that the murder weapon was the Crystal Sphere, which was hidden inside Elise's staff. So, the actual murder weapon was the staff, not the Shichishito, which only had the victim's and suspect's fingerprints but wasn't the actual weapon.

This means that the Shichishito wasn't used to commit the murder, which contradicts the earlier assumption. Therefore, the testimony that the Shichishito had the victim's and suspect's fingerprints is actually irrelevant because it wasn't the weapon used.

So, putting this together, the evidence about the Crystal Sphere and the staff being the actual murder weapon contradicts the testimony that the Shichishito was the apparent murder weapon. Additionally, the use of the snowmobile aligns with the tracks evidence, which doesn't directly contradict any testimonies except the one about Iris, which is more about the timeline.

Therefore, the main contradiction is between the evidence about the Crystal Sphere being the murder weapon and the testimony that the Shichishito was the apparent murder weapon.
</think>

cot:
Alright, let's try to tackle this problem step by step. I've got a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I need to find a pair where evidence and testimony contradict each other. The final answer should be in JSON format, like {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}.

First, I'll review the characters to understand the context. There's Phoenix Wright, Maya Fey, Godot, Pearl Fey, Bikini, Elise Deauxnim, Iris, Larry Butz, Dick Gumshoe, Franziska von Karma, Miles Edgeworth, Morgan Fey, and Dahlia Hawthorne. It seems like the setting is a legal case involving a murder at Hazakura Temple, with Phoenix as the defense attorney.

Next, I'll look at the evidences. There's an Attorney's Badge, Magatama, an occult magazine, a map of Hazakura Temple, a hanging scroll, a photo of Elise, Iris's hood, weather data, a note to Iris, the victim's staff, Shichishito, Elise's autopsy report, Iris's testimony, a crime photo, tracks photo, Larry's sketch, a crystal sphere, Kurain Master's Talisman, a burnt letter, a dagger, a stone lantern, and a Dusky Bridge photo.

Now, the testimonies. Bikini saw the murder at around 11 PM, Iris was in her room until the murder was discovered, and Larry Butz saw the bridge on fire around 10:30 PM.

I need to find a contradiction between an evidence and a testimony. Let's focus on the timeline and physical evidence.

Looking at the weather data, it snowed until around 10:50 PM, and lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45. Around 30 minutes passed between the fire starting and going out.

In the testimonies, Larry Butz said he was in his shack around 9 PM, so it would have been about 10:30 PM when he saw the bridge on fire. But the lightning struck at 10:45, and the fire started around then.

This suggests that the bridge was on fire around the same time Larry was checking it, which might mean he couldn't have seen the fire as described. Alternatively, the time discrepancy could indicate that the fire started earlier, but Larry didn't notice until later.

Another point is the note to Iris and the burnt letter, which might indicate premeditation or planning, conflicting with the sudden nature of the crime.

Putting this together, the key contradiction seems to be the timeline of events as described by Larry Butz and the actual weather conditions. The evidence shows the bridge was struck by lightning around 10:45, but Larry was in his shack around 10:30 PM, which might mean he couldn't have seen the fire as he described. Alternatively, the fire started earlier, and Larry's testimony doesn't account for that.

So, the evidence (weather data and lightning strike time) contradicts Larry Butz's testimony about the time he saw the bridge on fire.
</think>

cot:
Alright, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. I'm a bit new to this, so I'll take it step by step.

First, I need to understand the characters involved. There's Maya Fey, her sister Mia, Godot, Pearl, Bikini, Elise Deauxnim, Iris, Larry Butz, Phoenix Wright, Dick Gumshoe, Franziska von Karma, Miles Edgeworth, Morgan Fey, and Dahlia Hawthorne. Each has their own role and background.

Looking at the evidences, there's the Attorney's Badge, Magatama, an occult magazine, a temple map, a hanging scroll, a photo of Elise, Iris's Hood, weather data, a note to Iris, the victim's staff, Shichishito, Elise's autopsy report, Iris's testimony, a crime photo, tracks photo, Larry's sketch, a crystal sphere, Kurain Master's Talisman, a burnt letter, a dagger, a stone lantern, and a Dusky Bridge photo.

The testimonies include statements from Bikini, Butz, and others about what they saw or know about the incident.

Now, I need to find a pair where evidence contradicts testimony. Let's look for specific points where the evidence doesn't align with what someone said.

Starting with the weather data, it mentions that lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45 PM, and the fire started around that time, lasting about 30 minutes. This seems significant because it ties the timing of the incident to the weather.

Looking at the testimonies, Larry Butz mentions seeing the fire and responding to it. He said he arrived at the bridge around 9 PM and the fire started around 10:30 PM. He also mentioned seeing Nick (Phoenix Wright) show up less than a minute later.

But wait, according to the weather data, the lightning strike and fire happened around 10:45 PM, not 10:30 PM. So, there's a discrepancy here. Butz said the fire started around 10:30 PM, but the evidence says it was closer to 10:45 PM.
